prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Maya Fey
Description: My assistant and a disciple in the Kurain Tradition of spirit channeling.
Character 1
Name: Mia Fey
Description: Maya's older sister and my eternal mentor in life and law. Passed away 2 years ago. She was the attorney when Dahlia Hawthorne was sentenced to death. 
Character 2
Name: Godot
Description: A prosecutor who is shrouded in mystery. He seems to know me somehow.
Character 3
Name: Pearl Fey
Description: Maya's cousin, and channeling prodigy. She has amazingly powerful spiritual abilities.
Character 4
Name: Bikini
Description: A hearty, motherly nun at Hazakura Temple, a channeling dojo deep in the mountains.
Character 5
Name: Elise Deauxnim
Description: Kind-eyed author and illustrator of picture books. Pearls is huge fan of hers.
Character 6
Name: Iris
Description: A nun at Hazakura Temple. She reminds me so much of "her"...
Character 7
Name: Laurice Deauxnim* (when playing as Wright) → Larry Butz* (when playing as Edgeworth)
Description: Better known as Larry Butz. Current in training as Elise Deauxnim's pupil.
Character 8
Name: Phoenix Wright
Description: My friend since grade school. Fell from Dusky Bridge and is currently hospitalized.
Character 9
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 10
Name: Franziska von Karma
Description: My mentor, Manfred von Karma's, daughter. Born/raised in Germany. Prosecutor at 13.
Character 11
Name: Miles Edgeworth
Description: An old friend. Said to be #1 at the D.A.'s office. Studies foreign judicial systems now.
Character 12
Name: Morgan Fey
Description: Older sister of Misty Fey and mother of Pearl and Iris. Is in solitary confinement.
Character 13
Name: ?????? → Dahlia Hawthorne
Description: Morgan Fey's daughter and Iris's twin sister. Her father deals in jewelry apparently.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. It shows that I am a defense attorney.* (when playing as Wright) Received from Wright. He wasn't serious when he gave this to me... was he?* (when playing as Edgeworth)
Evidence 1
Name: Magatama
Description: A present from Maya. It reacts to people who have secrets in their hearts.* (when playing as Wright) Received from Wright. Something about reading people's hearts... What utter nonsense.* (when playing as Edgeworth)
Evidence 2
Name: Oh! Cult! New Year's Issue
Description: An occult magazine featuring Hazakura Temple. Click here for details.
Evidence 3
Name: Hazakura Temple Map
Description: Shows Hazakura Temple and the surrounding area. Click here for details.
Evidence 4
Name: Hanging Scroll
Description: Shows Misty Fey, Master of the Kurain Technique. Click here for details. Misty Fey's image is obscured by gravy. Godot described her as 'clad in her stunning Japanese garb surrounded by the hue and aroma of Western tastes'.
Evidence 5
Name: Photo of Elise
Description: Taken by her only pupil, Laurice Deauxnim. Click here for details.
Evidence 6
Name: Iris's Hood
Description: A magical hood said to offer protection from evil spirits. Received before the lights out bell the night of the crime. Protects from evil spirits.
Evidence 7
Name: Weather Data
Description: A regional weather report for the night of the crime.
Eagle Mountain Weather Data for Feb. 07
Snow, with occasional lightning strikes.

Snow: 7 to approx. 10:50 PM
Lightning: 10 to approx. 11 PM

Lightning struck Dusky Bridge at 10:45.
Around 30 minutes passed between
the fire starting and going out.
Evidence 8
Name: Note to Iris
Description: Found in the Main Hall. Maybe she dropped it? Click here for details.
Evidence 9
Name: Victim's Staff
Description: Carried by Elise Deauxnim when she was alive. Has her fingerprints on it. Has a sword hidden inside. No one knows this except Detective Gumshoe and I. Has a sword hidden inside. The actual weapon used to murder the victim.
Evidence 10
Name: Shichishito
Description: The apparent murder weapon. Had the victim's blood and the suspect's fingerprints on it. Had the victim's blood and the suspect's fingerprints on it, but is not the murder weapon.
Evidence 11
Name: Elise's Autopsy Report
Description: Time: 10 - 11 PM. Cause: loss of blood from stab in back. Body fell 10 ft. after death.
Evidence 12
Name: Iris's Testimony
Description: Rang lights out bell at 10 PM and was then in her room until the murder was discovered.
Evidence 13
Name: Crime Photo
Description: The courtyard where Elise Deauxnim was murdered. Click here for details.
Evidence 14
Name: Tracks Photo
Description: Taken that night. From Main Gate to Dusky Bridge. Click here for details.
Evidence 15
Name: Larry's Sketch
Description: Horrible sketch of what he saw the night of the crime. A bridge is on fire. There are two draw strings slanted above the bridge. A sihouette is seen gliding over the bridge. 
Evidence 16
Name: Crystal Sphere
Description: Found half-covered in snow near Dusky Bridge the night of the crime. Has blood on it. Found on outcropping near Dusky Bridge. Has blood on it. Came from the victim's staff.
Evidence 17
Name: Kurain Master's Talisman
Description: Worn by Elise Deauxnim. Found in the garden of the Inner Temple.
Evidence 18
Name: Burnt Letter
Description: Found by Gumshoe in the Inner Temple incinerator. Click here for details. Orders from Morgan Fey. Opened once before. Click here for details.
Evidence 19
Name: Dagger
Description: Found behind a tree in the Inner Temple garden. The blood is being analyzed now. Found stuck in a pine tree in Inner Temple Garden. The blood doesn't match the victim's.
Evidence 20
Name: Stone Lantern
Description: A lantern from the Inner Temple garden. Was not lit the night of the crime.
Evidence 21
Name: Dusky Bridge Photo
Description: Taken the morning after the crime. Click here for details.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I went to the Inner Temple that night and I saw it all happen in the garden.
Person: Iris
Testimony 1
Testimony: I saw Mystic Elise strike Mystic Maya with her staff!
Person: Iris
Testimony 2
Testimony: While Mystic Maya was still stumbling, Mystic Elise moved in to deliver a fatal strike!
Person: Iris
Testimony 3
Testimony: She threw her staff away and pulled a dagger from inside her robe!
Person: Iris
Testimony 4
Testimony: Mystic Maya tried desperately to defend herself and stole the weapon...!
Person: Iris
Testimony 5
Testimony: It was only in self-defense! You can't blame her for it!
Person: Iris

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, so I'm trying to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. Let me start by understanding all the details provided.

First, I'll look at the characters involved. There's Maya Fey, who is a defense attorney and a spirit medium. She's helping her friend Phoenix Wright, who is the defendant in this case. The victim is Elise Deauxnim, an author and illustrator. The crime took place at Hazakura Temple, which is a place where people practice the Kurain channeling technique.

Looking at the evidence, there's a photo taken by Melissa Foster, a college student who witnessed the incident. The photo shows the crime scene, which is the courtyard where Elise was murdered. There's also a sketch by Larry Butz, who claims to have seen the crime happen. The sketch shows a figure on Dusky Bridge, which is where the crime supposedly took place.

The testimony provided is from Larry Butz. He says he was sketching in front of Dusky Bridge when he saw a figure flying with a white hood. He claims this figure was Iris, a nun at Hazakura Temple. However, the crime photo shows that the crime occurred in the temple's courtyard, not on the bridge.

So, the key point here is the location of the crime. The evidence from the crime photo indicates the crime happened in the courtyard, while Larry's testimony places it on Dusky Bridge. This seems contradictory because the crime photo shows the actual location where Elise was killed, which doesn't match where Larry said he saw it happen.

Therefore, the evidence (Crime Photo) and the testimony (Larry Butz's account) contradict each other because they describe different locations for the crime.
</think>

cot:
Okay, I need to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other. Let's go through the evidence and testimonies step by step.

First, I'll list out all the evidence and testimonies provided. The key is to find a pair where the evidence and testimony contradict each other.

Looking at the evidence:
- Evidence 16: Crystal Sphere. It was found near Dusky Bridge, covered in snow and blood, from the victim's staff.
- Evidence 19: Dagger. Found in the Inner Temple garden, blood doesn't match the victim's.
- Evidence 21: Dusky Bridge Photo. Taken the morning after the crime.
- Evidence 13: Crime Photo. The courtyard where Elise was murdered.
- Evidence 14: Tracks Photo. Tracks leading from Main Gate to Dusky Bridge.
- Evidence 15: Larry's Sketch. Shows the bridge on fire with a silhouette.
- Evidence 9: Victim's Staff. Has a hidden sword, the actual murder weapon.
- Evidence 10: Shichishito. Apparent murder weapon but not the actual one.
- Evidence 11: Autopsy Report. Time of death 10-11 PM, cause of death by stabbing.
- Evidence 12: Iris's Testimony. She rang the bell at 10 PM and stayed in her room.
- Evidence 17: Kurain Master's Talisman. Found in Inner Temple garden.
- Evidence 18: Burnt Letter. Orders from Morgan Fey.
- Evidence 20: Stone Lantern. Not lit the night of the crime.
- Evidence 8: Note to Iris. Found in the Main Hall.
- Evidence 5: Photo of Elise. Holding a book and staff with a crystal sphere.
- Evidence 6: Iris's Hood. Protects from evil spirits.
- Evidence 7: Weather Data. Lightning at 10-11 PM, struck Dusky Bridge.
- Evidence 4: Hanging Scroll. Misty Fey's image obscured.
- Evidence 3: Hazakura Temple Map.
- Evidence 2: Oh! Cult! Magazine.
- Evidence 1: Magatama.
- Evidence 0: Attorney's Badge.
- Evidence 10: Shichishito.
- Evidence 14: Tracks Photo.
- Evidence 15: Larry's Sketch.
- Evidence 16: Crystal Sphere.
- Evidence 17: Kurain Master's Talisman.
- Evidence 18: Burnt Letter.
- Evidence 19: Dagger.
- Evidence 20: Stone Lantern.
- Evidence 21: Dusky Bridge Photo.

Now, looking at the testimonies:
- Testimony 0: Iris saw Maya hit Elise with the staff and steal the weapon.
- Testimony 1: Iris saw Maya stab Elise.
- Testimony 2: Elise was on the defensive near the lantern.
- Testimony 3: Elise collapsed after the knife was thrown.
- Testimony 4: Elise managed to fling the knife away.
- Testimony 5: It was self-defense.

I need to find a contradiction between evidence and testimony. 

Looking at Testimony 0 and 1, Iris says Maya hit Elise with the staff and stole the weapon, then stabbed her. But Evidence 9 says the staff had a hidden sword, which was the actual murder weapon. If the staff was the actual weapon, then Maya using it would make sense. But if the dagger was the actual weapon (Evidence 19), then the testimony might contradict the evidence if the staff wasn't used.

Wait, Evidence 9 says the staff has a hidden sword, which is the actual weapon. Testimony 0 says Maya used the staff to hit Elise and then stole the weapon. So if the staff was the actual murder weapon, the testimony aligns with the evidence. But if the dagger was the actual weapon, there's a contradiction.

But according to Evidence 9, the staff is the actual weapon. So Testimony 0 aligns with Evidence 9. 

Looking at Testimony 3, Iris says Elise collapsed after the knife was thrown. Evidence 19 says the dagger's blood doesn't match the victim. If the dagger wasn't used, then Testimony 3 is incorrect, contradicting the evidence.

Wait, Testimony 3 says Elise collapsed after the knife was thrown, implying the dagger was used. But Evidence 19 says the dagger's blood doesn't match the victim, suggesting it wasn't used. So Testimony 3 contradicts Evidence 19.

Another point: Evidence 16 is the crystal sphere from the staff. Testimony 0 says Maya stole the weapon, which aligns with Evidence 9. 

I think the main contradiction is between Testimony 3 and Evidence 19. Testimony 3 says the dagger was used, but Evidence 19 says the dagger's blood doesn't match the victim, indicating it wasn't the murder weapon. So they contradict each other.
</think>

cot:
Okay, so I'm trying to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. Let's break it down step by step.

First, I need to look through all the evidence provided and see how they might relate to each testimony given by the characters. The goal is to find a pair where one piece of evidence directly contradicts a testimony.

Looking at the evidence, I see several items like the Crime Photo, Weather Data, and Iris's Hood. The Weather Data mentions that snow stopped around 10:50 PM, and lightning strikes occurred until 11 PM. The Crime Photo shows the courtyard where Elise was murdered.

Now, looking at the testimonies, Iris claims she dragged Elise's body across Dusky Bridge after the snow had stopped. But according to the Weather Data, the snow stopped around 10:50 PM, which would have made the ground slippery but not snowy anymore.

Wait, but the Crime Photo shows that the snow was still falling when the crime happened. If the snow had stopped before the crime, the ground wouldn't have been slippery during the murder. This seems contradictory because if the snow stopped at 10:50 PM, the ground would have been dry by the time of the murder around 11 PM.

So, the key contradiction is between the Weather Data (Evidence 7) and Iris's testimony (Testimony 6). The weather data says the snow stopped at 10:50 PM, but Iris claims she dragged the body across the bridge after the snow had stopped, implying it was still snowing during the crime.
</think>

cot:
Okay, so I'm trying to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. Let's go through the evidence and testimonies one by one.

First, I'll look at the evidence provided. Evidence 0 is the Attorney's Badge, which is just proof of my profession. Not relevant here. Evidence 1 is the Magatama, a spiritual tool Maya uses. Evidence 2 is the magazine featuring Hazakura Temple. Evidence 3 is the map of the temple. Evidence 4 is the hanging scroll with Misty Fey's image. Evidence 5 is the photo of Elise. Evidence 6 is Iris's Hood, which has protective properties. Evidence 7 is the weather data from the night of the crime. Evidence 8 is the note to Iris. Evidence 9 is the victim's staff. Evidence 10 is the Shichishito, the apparent murder weapon. Evidence 11 is the autopsy report. Evidence 12 is Iris's testimony. Evidence 13 is the crime photo. Evidence 14 is the tracks photo. Evidence 15 is Larry's sketch. Evidence 16 is the crystal sphere. Evidence 17 is the Kurain Master's Talisman. Evidence 18 is the burnt letter. Evidence 19 is the dagger. Evidence 20 is the stone lantern. Evidence 21 is the Dusky Bridge photo.

Now, looking at the testimonies. Testimony 0 from Maya says she was attacked and lost consciousness. Testimony 1 says she was struck over the head. Testimony 2 says she stumbled against the stone lantern. Testimony 3 says she screamed for help. Testimony 4 says she saw a man behind her attacker. Testimony 5 says something warm splashed over her. Testimony 6 says she lost consciousness.

I need to find a pair where the evidence and testimony contradict each other. Let's see, the dagger (Evidence 19) was found in the garden, but the autopsy report (Evidence 11) says the victim died from a stab wound. Testimony 6 says Maya saw a man behind her attacker by the stone lantern's light.

Wait, the dagger was found in the garden, but the autopsy report indicates the murder weapon was the Shichishito. So, the dagger isn't the murder weapon, but the testimony says Maya saw a man with a weapon.

Hmm, maybe the dagger found in the garden (Evidence 19) contradicts the testimony that the Shichishito was used. So, the evidence says the dagger wasn't the murder weapon, but the testimony says the Shichishito was used.

So, the contradiction is between Evidence 10 (Shichishito) and Testimony 4 (Maya's testimony about seeing a man with a weapon).
</think>

cot:
Alright, I'm trying to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. Let me go through the information step by step.

First, I'll look at the characters and their roles. Maya Fey is my assistant, and she's involved in a case where the victim, Elise Deauxnim, was murdered. The key evidence here is the dagger found in the Inner Temple garden, which has blood that doesn't match the victim's. The testimony from Maya Fey states that she found the dagger and suspects it might be the murder weapon.

Now, looking at the evidence, the dagger is described as having blood that doesn't match the victim's. This suggests it wasn't used in the murder. However, Maya's testimony claims it's the murder weapon. This creates a contradiction because the evidence doesn't support her claim.

So, the contradiction is between the dagger evidence and Maya's testimony.
</think>

cot:
Alright, so I've been given this problem where I need to identify a contradiction between an evidence and a testimony in a fictional court case. The case involves characters like Maya Fey, Mia Fey, Godot, Dick Gumshoe, and others. There's a lot of evidence listed, including photos, notes, and other items, and various testimonies from the characters involved.

First, I'll start by carefully reading through the provided evidence and testimonies to understand the context of the case. It seems like the victim, Elise Deauxnim, was killed, and there are multiple suspects and pieces of evidence pointing to different possibilities.

Looking at the testimonies, one of them mentions that the defendant, Iris, was seen fleeing the scene on a snowmobile. The evidence, however, states that the snowmobile tracks were found near the crime scene. This seems contradictory because if Iris was seen fleeing on a snowmobile, the evidence should support that she used it to escape. But according to the evidence, the snowmobile tracks were present, which might suggest she actually used it. 

Wait, that doesn't seem contradictory. If the evidence shows snowmobile tracks, and the testimony says she was seen fleeing on one, that would actually support each other. Maybe I misread it.

Another point is that the defendant's testimony claims she was in her room until the murder was discovered, but the evidence shows she was seen near the crime scene. This could be a contradiction because if she was in her room, she couldn't have been near the crime scene.

But the evidence says she was seen near the crime scene, and her testimony says she was in her room. That's a contradiction because she can't be in two places at once.

Wait, no, the evidence says she was seen near the crime scene, but her testimony says she was in her room. That would mean she's lying.

But the evidence also mentions that the snowmobile tracks were found, which might suggest someone else used it. Maybe the defendant's testimony about being in her room is false because the evidence shows she was near the crime scene.

So, the contradiction is between the defendant's testimony of being in her room and the evidence showing her near the crime scene.

After analyzing, I think the evidence about the snowmobile tracks and the defendant's testimony about her location are contradictory.

But wait, the evidence about the snowmobile tracks might not directly link to her. Maybe someone else used it.

I think I'm getting confused. The key is to find one pair where the evidence and testimony contradict each other.

Perhaps the defendant's testimony about being in her room contradicts the evidence of her being near the crime scene.

Yes, that makes sense. The evidence shows she was near the crime scene, but she testified she was in her room.

So, the contradiction is between her testimony and the evidence showing her presence near the crime scene.

Finally, I need to present this as a JSON object with the evidence and testimony indices.
</think>
